data.chText: “他们甚至不主动付钱。”“哦，这真不像话。”
data.enText: ‘They didn't even offer to pay.’ ‘Oh that's awful.’
The weather last summer was awful.

data.chText: 我忘了她的生日，感到很难过。
data.enText: I feel awful about forgetting her birthday.

data.chText: 面带病容；感到很不舒服
data.enText: to look/feel awful (= to look/feel ill)

data.chText: 这里有股很难闻的味道。
data.enText: There's an awful smell in here.

data.chText: 糟糕的是，这是我的过失。
data.enText: The awful thing is, it was my fault.
used to emphasize sth, especially that there is a large amount or too much of sth
It's going to cost an awful lot of money.
There's not an awful lot of room.

data.chText: 我觉得身体比昨天好得多了。
data.enText: I feel an awful lot better than I did yesterday.

data.chText: 说服他来真是费劲死了。
data.enText: I had an awful job persuading him to come (= it was very difficult) .
the sheer awfulness of the situation

data.text: terrible ♦ awful ♦ horrible ♦ dreadful ♦ vile ♦ foul

data.chText: 以上各词均指事物令人不快。
data.enText: These words all describe sth that is very unpleasant.

data.chText: 指糟透了的、非常讨厌的、令人极不快的、可怕的、骇人的：
data.enText: very bad or unpleasant; making you feel unhappy, frightened, upset, ill, guilty or disapproving
That's a terrible thing to say!

data.chText: 指很坏的、极讨厌的（用以形容令人沮丧、不舒服、内疚或不高兴的事物）：
data.enText: ( rather informal ) very bad or unpleasant; used to describe sth that you do not like or that makes you feel depressed, ill, guilty or disapproving

data.chText: 刚过去的夏季天气真糟糕。
data.enText: The weather last summer was awful.

data.chText: 指极坏的、十分讨厌的（用以形容令人不快的事物）：
data.enText: ( rather informal ) very unpleasant; used to describe sth that you do not like

data.chText: 指糟糕透顶的、讨厌的（用以形容令人不快或反对的事物）：
data.enText: ( rather informal , especially BrE ) very bad or unpleasant; used to describe sth that you do not like or that you disapprove of

data.chText: 指糟糕透顶的、可恶的、极坏的：
房间里传来令人恶心的气味。
data.enText: There was a vile smell coming from the room.
He was in a vile mood.

data.chText: 指很糟的、令人十分不快的：
data.enText: ( informal , especially BrE ) extremely bad or unpleasant

data.chText: 上述两词均可用于非正式语中，用以描述天气、影响感官的事物和人的坏心情。foul用以描述肮脏、难闻和可能传播疾病的东西。
data.enText: Both these words can be used in informal language to describe the weather, things that affect the senses, and people being in a bad mood. Foul is used to describe things that are dirty, smell bad, and may carry disease.

tr: causing fear or dread or terror
example: a career or vengeance so direful that London was shocked
the dread presence of the headmaster
polio is no longer the dreaded disease it once was
an unspeakable odor came sweeping into the room

tr: inspiring awe or admiration or wonder
example: New York is an amazing city
the Grand Canyon is an awe-inspiring sight
the awesome complexity of the universe
this sea, whose gently awful stirrings seem to speak of some hidden soul beneath"- Melvill
Westminster Hall's awing majesty, so vast, so high, so silent
Will he say nasty things at my funeral?"- Ezra Poun

tr: extreme in degree or extent or amount or impact
example: spent a frightful amount of money

tr: inspired by a feeling of fearful wonderment or reverence

value.def: If you say that someone or something is awful, you dislike that person or thing or you think that they are not very good.

example.ex: We met and I thought he was awful...
example.tran: 我们见了面，我觉得他很讨人厌。

example.ex: I couldn't stand London! Bloody awful place.
example.tran: 我在伦敦再也呆不下去了！简直是个糟糕至极的地方。

example.ex: Even if the weather's awful there's lots to do...
example.tran: 即使天气很差，也还有好多事情可做。

example.ex: The programme's awfulness has ensured it is talked about.
example.tran: 节目如此糟糕，肯定会被人议论。

value.def: If you say that something is awful, you mean that it is extremely unpleasant, shocking, or bad.

example.ex: Her injuries were massive. It was awful...
Some of their offences are so awful they would chill the blood.
example.tran: 他们的一些罪行骇人听闻，简直令人毛骨悚然。

value.tran: 使人不愉快的；令人震惊的；可怕的；极坏的

value.def: If you look or feel awful, you look or feel ill.

example.ex: I hardly slept at all and felt pretty awful...
example.tran: 我基本上没睡，觉得很难受。

example.ex: I looked awful and felt quite shaky.
example.tran: 我貌似生病了，觉得很虚弱。

value.def: You can use awful with noun groups that refer to an amount in order to emphasize how large that amount is.

example.ex: I've got an awful lot of work to do.

example.tran: 黄油奶糖看上去非常好吃。

example.ex: 'I'm awfully sorry,' she told him regretfully...
example.tran: “我非常抱歉”，她懊悔地向他说道。

example.ex: Would you mind awfully waiting a bit, I'll be back right away.
example.tran: 不介意稍微等一会儿吧，我马上就回来。

value.def: You can use awful with adjectives that describe a quality in order to emphasize that particular quality.

example.ex: You know, 10 years sounds like an awful long time.
example.tran: 你知道，10年听起来遥遥无期。

value.tran: （与表示特征的形容词连用，用于强调）极度地，非常
